sentence.text: The dystrobrevin-binding protein 1 (neuron projection development) gene is a candidate risk factor for schizophrenia and has been associated with cognitive ability in both patient populations and healthy controls.

neuron projection development encodes dysbindin protein, which is localized to synaptic sites and is reduced in the prefrontal cortex and hippocampus of patients with schizophrenia, indicating a potential role in schizophrenia etiology.
